My current feeling is that the best thing to do is to somehow allow
custom =
categories of test results.  I'm very reluctant to increase the
number of b=
uilt-in result categories, since such a change is one of
the most likely to=
 break, or at least be under-implemented, in IDEs
and build frameworks.

I'=
m open to ideas about the best way to do this.

   David

On Thu, Apr 14, 2=
011 at 3:26 PM, lars.vonk <lars.vonk@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I would li=
ke to see progress in (acceptance) tests not yet implemented. I want these =
reported differently than normal failures. Is there a way in JUnit to disti=
nct between expected failing tests and "normal" failing tests?
>
> So in a =
report I would like to see something like:
>

> Failures:0

ors: 0
